column4: Dang... I was hoping someone would know... Well I guess i'll find out in an hour or so...
i assume since GKSU won't start gparted will just halt after the current operation?
how can it be doing an operation if it won't start
what's the problem
gksu crashed and won't start up... i'm assuming because gparted is running... i'm wondering if it needs gksu to do operations...
gksu crashed ? once you launch an application it's not running,
how are you starting firefox ?
alright i started it from terminal with this error... "device or resource busy"
ok, why do you think that's a problem with gksu
well soon as i saw that error i realized it wasn't gksu
no idea what resources are busy, is your machine still doing the hard disk re-size
yup
well i feel much better about this now... if anything it won't finish the last operation and i'll just have to restart or something and do it then... thanks bro
you fixed yourself, no problem
what's the problem
o nothing, just trying to remember that special partitioning that ubuntu server has... is it called LVM?
lvm is logical volume managment, it's dynamic partitions made out of groups of disks
arh won't teach him how to use / manage ubuntu
o my bad, misunderstood what he wanted
moment of truth with my gparted issue :3
yup it crashed... sigh... time to restart then...
how annoying
alright growing partition
booting into resized partition... and... and... it froze >.< no problem though... just restart...
